data.title: Centerville, IN
data.meta_description: In 2022, Centerville, IN had a population of 2.76k people with a median age of 40 and a median household income of $51,071. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Centerville, IN grew from 2,748 to 2,760, a 0.437% increase and its median household income grew from $47,563 to $51,071, a 7.38% increase.
data.text:
In 2022, Centerville, IN had a population of 2.76k people with a median age of 40 and a median household income of $51,071. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Centerville, IN grew from 2,748 to 2,760, a 0.437% increase and its median household income grew from $47,563 to $51,071, a 7.38% increase.

Most people in Centerville, IN drove alone to work, and the average commute time was 17.6 minutes. The average car ownership in Centerville, IN was 2 cars per household.

Centerville, IN is home to a population of 2.76k people, from which 98.9% are citizens. As of 2022, 1.96% of Centerville, IN residents were born outside of the country (54 people).

In 2022, there were 26.9 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (2.48k people) in Centerville, IN than any other race or ethnicity. There were 92 Two+ (Hispanic) and 75 Other (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

As of 2022, 98.9% of Centerville, IN residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Centerville, IN was 100%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been decreasing.

The following chart shows US citizenship percentages in Centerville, IN compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

In 2022, there were 26.9 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (2.48k people) in Centerville, IN than any other race or ethnicity. There were 92 Two+ (Hispanic) and 75 Other (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

8.04% of the people in Centerville, IN are hispanic (222 people).

The following chart shows the 7 races represented in Centerville, IN as a share of the total population.

As of 2022, 1.96% of Centerville, IN residents (54 people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Centerville, IN was 1.13%, meaning that the rate has been increasing.

The following chart shows the percentage of foreign-born residents in Centerville, IN compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

The economy of Centerville, IN employs 1.17k people. The largest industries in Centerville, IN are Health Care & Social Assistance (284 people), Manufacturing (245 people), and Retail Trade (114 people), and the highest paying industries are Professional, Scientific, & Management, & Administrative & Waste Management Services ($87,632), Transportation & Warehousing, & Utilities ($76,563), and Transportation & Warehousing ($76,563).

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Centerville, IN declined at a rate of −4.56%, from 1.23k employees to 1.17k employees.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Centerville, IN, are Office & Administrative Support Occupations (209 people), Management Occupations (149 people), and Installation, Maintenance, & Repair Occupations (116 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Centerville, IN.

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Centerville, IN declined at a rate of −4.56%, from 1.23k employees to 1.17k employees.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Centerville, IN, are Health Care & Social Assistance (284 people), Manufacturing (245 people), and Retail Trade (114 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Centerville, IN, though some of these residents may live in Centerville, IN and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

As of February 2023, there are 3.21M people employed in Indiana. This represents a 2.48% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Right after the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, during April 2020, a general dip can be seen across industry sectors, resulting in an overall decline in employment by 15.4%.

The following chart shows monthly employment numbers for each industry sector in Indiana.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Indiana went to Donald J. Trump with 57% of the vote. The runner-up was Joseph R Biden Jr. (41%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (1.95%).

Todd Young and Mike Braun are the senators currently representing the state of Indiana. In the United States, senators are elected to 6-year terms with the terms for individual senators staggered.

Indiana is currently represented by 9 members in the U.S. house, and members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms.

The median property value in Centerville, IN was $128,300 in 2022, which is 0.455 times smaller than the national average of $281,900. Between 2021 and 2022 the median property value increased from $103,800 to $128,300, a 23.6% increase. The homeownership rate in Centerville, IN is 68%, which is approximately the same as the national average of 64.8%.

People in Centerville, IN have an average commute time of 17.6 minutes, and they drove alone to work. Car ownership in Centerville, IN is approximately the same as the national average, with an average of 2 cars per household.

In 2022, the median household income of the 1.09k households in Centerville, IN grew to $51,071 from the previous year's value of $47,563.

The following chart displays the households in Centerville, IN distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $75k - $100k range.

In 2022, the income inequality in Indiana was 0.448 according to the GINI calculation of the wage distribution. Income inequality had a 0.283% decline from 2021 to 2022, which means that wage distribution grew somewhat more even. The GINI for Indiana was lower than than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed more evenly in Indiana in comparison to the national average.

This chart shows the number of workers in Indiana across various wage buckets compared to the national average.

In 2022, 83.7% of workers in Centerville, IN drove alone to work, followed by those who carpooled to work (7.18%) and those who worked at home (7.18%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Centerville, IN have a shorter commute time (17.6 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 1.86% of the workforce in Centerville, IN have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The chart below shows how the median household income in Centerville, IN compares to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

14.2% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Centerville, IN (363 out of 2.55k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is higher than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Females 35 - 44, followed by Males 45 - 54 and then Females 25 - 34.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Centerville, IN is White, followed by Hispanic and Black.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

91.1% of the population of Centerville, IN has health coverage, with 41.1% on employee plans, 26.3% on Medicaid, 10.3% on Medicare, 11.6% on non-group plans, and 1.82% on military or VA plans.

Primary care physicians in Wayne County, IN see 1687 patients per year on average, which represents a 0.118% decrease from the previous year (1689 patients). Compare this to dentists who see 1545 patients per year, and mental health providers who see 209 patients per year.

Primary care physicians in Wayne County, IN see an average of 1,687 patients per year. This represents a 0.118% decrease from the previous year (1,689 patients).

The following chart shows how the number of patients seen by primary care physicians has been changing over time in Wayne County, IN in comparison to its neighboring geographies.

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 31% under 18 years, 16.5% between 18 and 34 years, 40% between 35 and 64 years, and 12.5% over 64 years.

By gender, of the total number of insured persons, 51.5% were men and 48.5% were women.

The following chart shows the number of people with health coverage by gender.
